message_1: What is the rate of diffusion of ammonia gas in air at 25 °C and atmospheric pressure of 1 atm?  The diffusion coefficient of ammonia in air at 25°C is 0.15 cm²/s. Calculate the distance a molecule of ammonia will travel on average in 10 seconds starting from rest in still air.
message_2:
To calculate the distance a molecule of ammonia will travel on average in 10 seconds, we can use the formula:

distance = sqrt(2 * D * t)

where distance is the average distance traveled, D is the diffusion coefficient, and t is the time.

Given the diffusion coefficient (D) of ammonia in air at 25°C is 0.15 cm²/s and the time (t) is 10 seconds, we can plug these values into the formula:

distance = sqrt(2 * 0.15 cm²/s * 10 s)

distance = sqrt(3 cm²)

distance ≈ 1.73 cm

So, a molecule of ammonia will travel on average approximately 1.73 cm in 10 seconds starting from rest in still air at 25°C and atmospheric pressure of 1 atm.
